abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Capacity Building
            Project for Private Sector Promotion is rated as
            satisfactory, sustainability as likely, institutional
            development impact as modest, Bank performance as
            satisfactory, and Borrower performance as satisfactory. The
            Asian financial crisis of 1998 dampened somewhat the effects
            of Cape Verde's promotional efforts to attract Asian
            foreign investment, especially in the manufacturing sector.
            Moreover, high levels of internal government debt restricted
            public expenditures and had negative impact on project
            implementation, both in terms of delays in the disbursement
            of counterpart funds and the allocation of government
            resoures for important complementary activities. Several
            lessons were learned from implementing the project: a) Open
            and constructive dialogue with Government ensures prompt
            corrective actions when needed. b) Careful assessment of
            weaknesses of partner institutions and or beneficiaries is
            essential for successful implementation of project
            activities. c) Government commitment and collaboration with
            other donors and key stakeholders is essential for project
            success. d) Complex issues require considerable involvement
            and proactivity.
